Hi David,

> > Here is why.

>
> > With test first, you have something like:  Test v1, Code v1, Test v2,=

> Code

> >
> > If you postpone your t=
esting a bit, you have:  Code v1, Code v2, Code
> v3,
> > Test v3, Commit.
=
> >

> >
>
> =
I think we disagree here, but before I say more, I'd like to know how
> muc=
h.  I hear that "It _can be argued_ that writing test firsts can be
> detri=
mental to your velocity", and then "TDD _can be_ a big waste of
> time", an=
d then "The latter approach _will_ get you to your goal much

ich of these is your personal experience?


Sorry to dodge your question, b=
ut I really don't think my experience has
much relevance in what I wrote ab=
ove.

case
and four tasks in the second one.  Isn't it obvious that quite often, =
the
former approach will take longer than the latter?
